title: Jabran Rafique
intro: I am a software engineer with a passion for the web. I have an experience of more than eight years in developing scalable, performant, and interactive web applications with a keen eye for best practices and industry standards.I am a seasoned software engineer with over eight years of experience in developing scalable, performant, and interactive web applications. My passion for the web extends to a commitment to best practices and industry standards. I thrive on driving technology adoption, leading strategic initiatives, and mentoring cross-disciplinary teams.

employments.intro: As a Staff Engineer, I inherited a majority of responsibilities from my previous Tech Lead role and expand to encompass broader responsibilities such as strategic planning, and technical directions.
experience: Spearheading strategic planning and technical directions.
Leading migration of legacy web apps to modern Frontend tech (ReactJS, NodeJS).
Overseeing CI/CD pipelines using tools such as BitBucket, Bamboo, AWS, and Cloudflare.
Driving performance improvements with tools like Lighthouse and WebPageTest.
Providing technical leadership, strategic guidance, and mentorship to foster a culture of learning and growth.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive technical decisions aligning with long-term business goals.

employments.intro: As a Frontend Tech Lead, I was adept at mentoring and managing teams, driving modernization efforts, and ensuring code quality and platform health.
experience: Managed and mentored Frontend development teams.
Drove modernization efforts, ensuring code quality and platform health.
Led migration from legacy PHP stack to modern tech (ReactJS, NodeJS, Remix).
Monitored platform health using tools such as AppDynamics and Heap.
Participated in recruitment efforts to build a high-performing engineering team.
Contributed to user testing and AB testing initiatives using tools like Cloudflare Workers, VWO, and SEOClarity.

employments.intro: Involved in planning and development of new features and maintaining the existing codebases by keeping up with best practices, performance, security and industry standards.
experience: Contributed to Frontend stack migration to AWS.
Played a key role in the platform rebrand in 2016.
Upgraded Frontend tools chain and modernized the stack.
Developed Symfony app for automated customer signups flow.
Utilized NodeJS, ReactJS, and other modern tools for REST API development.

employments.intro: Oversee the social apps and websites development for clients, mentor and manage the development team and maintain technical roadmap.
experience: Oversaw social apps and websites development for various clients.
Managed development cycles, timelines, and roadmaps.
Mentored junior developers and freelancers.
Developed and maintained LAMPHP stack-based MVC framework.

freelancing.description: I developed a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) platform in LAM(PHP) stack to monitor countrywide fibre-optic operations internally. The monitoring platform extensively used Google Maps API underneath with drawings API on top of it to add lines and station data to showcase service status in real-time. The source of data was the emails generated by the stations on service updates.
I developed the website, designed branding and an internal logistics consignment system using LAM(PHP) stack that had helped me learn advance aspects of web development.

I designed the wireframes and prototypes. Based on these designs, I developed the website and inventory UI for electro-mechanical material related to the aerospace industry using open-source technologies LAM(PHP).

projects.description: I develop apps based on personal ideas and interests in my spare time. Most of my projects are open-sourced and the code is hosted at GitHub. Some of these projects are:

data.name: Reason to Follow
data.description: A browser extension for remembering reasons to follow accounts on social platforms.

data.name: Childcare Vouchers
data.description: A directory of businesses accepting childcare vouchers as payment.

data.name: Guess Where
data.description: A geo quiz app built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Google Maps API.

data.name: Work Clock
data.description: MacOS menu bar utility app written in Swift for remote work in different timezones.

data.name: Google Maps API React Hook
data.description: Custom React hook to integrate Google Maps JavaScript SDK in React apps.

data.name: Facebook API React Hook
data.description: Custom React hook to integrate Facebook JavaScript SDK in React apps.

data.name: Covidonation
data.description: Directory of organizations helping during the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.name: Covid19 Today
data.description: Daily updated figures for COVID-19 for every country and continent.

data.name: Socialmedia.js
data.description: A JavaScript library that simplifies the social media integration into the web apps. It has a comprehensive documentation covering setup and usage for various supportive social media platforms.

data.name: Fetchwitter
data.description: An easy-to-use PHP client to authenticate and consume Twitter API in web apps. Fetchwitter exposes a small and simple API to fetch Tweets and perform searches with terms such as a hashtag. It also has a WordPress plugin for easy integration into WordPress.

data.name: CSV Parser
data.description: A PHP client to parse CSV data from a file, stream, or string and convert into indexed or associative array format.

data.name: JS Memcache
data.description: A lightweight JavaScript in-memory cache to store data for better performance by saving on network requests.

education.type: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
education.school: West London College of Business & Management Sciences

volunteering: Contributed to Google's Map Maker project (2008-2013) to map unmapped areas, focusing on developing countries. Served in various community-leading positions, guiding a global community of mappers, setting regional mapping standards, organizing events, and leading training sessions.
For more information, visit Google LatLng Blog.
